sen.j: 左京区（さきょうく）は、京都市を構成する11区のうちのひとつ。
sen.e: Sakyo Ward is one of the eleven wards consitituting Kyoto City.
Sakyo Ward is one of the eleven wards consitituting Kyoto City.
Sakyo Ward is one of the eleven wards that constitute Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 1929年（昭和4年）に上京区から分区して成立。
sen.e: It was separated from Kamigyo Ward in 1929 to become a new ward.
It was separated from Kamigyo Ward in 1929 to become a new ward.
It was separated from Kamigyo Ward in 1929 to become a new ward.

sen.j: 京都市の東北部を占め、東は滋賀県大津市に接し、南は三条通をはさんで東山区、山科区に、北は南丹市、滋賀県高島市に接している。
sen.e: Located in the northeast part of Kyoto City, Sakyo Ward borders Otsu City of Shiga Prefecture on the east side, borders Higashiyam Ward and Yamashina Ward on the south side across Sanjo-dori street and boders Nantan City of Kyoto Prefecture and Takashima City of Shiga Prefecture on the north side.

Located in the northeast part of Kyoto City, Sakyo Ward borders Otsu City of Shiga Prefecture on the east side, borders Higashiyam Ward and Yamashina Ward on the south side across Sanjo-dori street and borders Nantan City of Kyoto Prefecture and Takashima City of Shiga Prefecture on the north side.

Located in the northeast part of Kyoto City, Sakyo Ward borders Otsu City of Shiga Prefecture on the east side, borders Higashiyama Ward and Yamashina Ward on the south side across Sanjo-dori Street and borders Nantan City of Kyoto Prefecture and Takashima City of Shiga Prefecture on the north side.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 区内には川端通、東大路通、白川通などの通りが南北に走っている。
sen.e: Within the ward, such streets as Kawabata-dori Street, Higashi Oji-dori Street and Shirakawa-dori Street run in the north-south direction.
Within the ward, such streets as Kawabata-dori Street, Higashi Oji-dori Street and Shirakawa-dori Street run in the north-south direction.
Within the ward, such streets as Kawabata-dori Street, Higashi Oji-dori Street and Shirakawa-dori Street run in the north-south direction.

sen.j: 区南部は住宅地や文教地区になっている一方（岩倉地区などの北寄りの地域は市街化調整区域に指定されているため、高層建築物などの大規模開発が制限されている影響で、田畑も多く残る）、区北部は山間地で林業が盛んである。
sen.e: The southern part of the ward is mostly occupied by housing areas and school zones (however, in the northern area of the part, which is deisignated as an urbanization-restricted area, fields still remain because large-scale development, such as constructing a high-rise building, is restricted there due to the designation), and its northern part is mountaineous and the forest industry flourishes there.

The southern part of the ward is mostly occupied by housing areas and school zones (however, in the northern area of the part, which is designated as an urbanization-restricted area, fields still remain because large-scale development, such as constructing a high-rise building, is restricted there due to the designation), and its northern part is mountainous and the forest industry flourishes there.

The southern part of the ward is mostly occupied by housing areas and school zones (however, in the northern area of the part, such as Iwakura area, fields still remain because large-scale development, such as constructing a high-rise building, is restricted due to the designation as an urbanization-restricted area), and its northern part is mountainous and the forest industry flourishes there.
sen.cmt: 一部文章を修正しました。

sen.j: 有名な寺社としては銀閣寺・南禅寺・下鴨神社・平安神宮がある。
sen.e: Famous temples and shrines, such as Ginkaku-ji Temple, Nanzen-ji Temple, Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and Heian-jingu Shrine, are located in this ward.
Famous temples and shrines, such as Ginkaku-ji Temple, Nanzen-ji Temple, Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and Heian-jingu Shrine, are located in this ward.
Famous temples and shrines, such as Ginkaku-ji Temple, Nanzen-ji Temple, Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and Heian-jingu Shrine, are located in this ward.

sen.j: また北部には鞍馬寺・貴船神社・三千院・岩倉具視幽閉跡・修学院離宮などがある。
sen.e: In the northern part of the ward, Kurama-dera Temple, Kifune-jinja Shrine, Sanzen-in Temple, the site where Tomomi IWAKURA was once confined, and Shugakuin Rikyu (Shugakuin Imperial Villa) are also located.

In the northern part of the ward, Kurama-dera Temple, Kifune-jinja Shrine, Sanzen-in Temple, the site where Tomomi IWAKURA was once confined, and Shugakuin Rikyu (Shugakuin Imperial Villa) are also located.

In the northern part of the ward, Kurama-dera Temple, Kifune-jinja Shrine, Sanzen-in Temple, the site where Tomomi IWAKURA was once confined, and Shugakuin Rikyu (Shugakuin Imperial Villa) are also located.

sen.j: 八瀬大原から大原女と呼ばれる山菜売りの女性が行商に来ることもあった。
sen.e: In the past, women called "Oharame" sometimes came from Yase Ohara to this area for selling wild vegetables they collected in the mountain area.
In the past, women called "Oharame" sometimes came from Yase Ohara to this area to sell wild vegetables they collected in the mountain area.
In the past, women called "Oharame" sometimes came from Yase Ohara to this area to sell wild vegetables they collected in the mountain area.

sen.j: また、北白川には花の行商を生業とする白川女が存在していたが、現在は存続していない模様である。
sen.e: Shirakawame, who was specifically engaged in peddling flowers, existed in Kita Shirakawa, but it is likely that they do not exisit anymore.
Shirakawame, who were specifically engaged in peddling flowers, existed in Kita Shirakawa, but it is likely that they do not exisit anymore.
Shirakawame, who were specifically engaged in peddling flowers, existed in Kita Shirakawa, but it is likely that they do not exist anymore.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 他に北白川の山間部には、白川砂と言う特産品もある。
sen.e: In the mountaineous area of Kita Shirakaw, a speciality called Shirakawa-suna Sand exists.
In the mountaineous area of Kita Shirakaw, a speciality called Shirakawa-suna Sand exists.
In the mountainous area of Kita Shirakawa, a specialty called Shirakawa-suna Sand exists.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 「左京」とは、天皇の在所すなわち御所から見て左側の意。
sen.e: Sakyo indicates the left side of Gosho (the imperial palace) where the emperor live.
Sakyo indicates the left side of Gosho (the imperial palace) where the emperor lives.
Sakyo indicates the left side of Gosho (the imperial palace) where the emperor lives.

sen.j: 天皇は南面して玉座に座っていたので左は東になる。
sen.e: Since thee mperor takes the imperial seat facing the south, the left actually indicates the east side.
Since the emperor sat in the imperial seat facing the south, the left actually indicates the east side.
Since the emperor sat in the imperial seat facing the south, the left in fact indicates the east side.

sen.j: そのため地図上では右にありながら左京と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Therefore, the area is called Sakyo, although bing placed on the right side on maps.
Therefore, the area is called Sakyo, although it is located on the right side on maps.
Therefore, the area is called Sakyo, although it is located on the right side on maps.

sen.j: 本来左京と言えば平安京のうちの東側（洛陽または洛中）のことであったが、京都市の行政区として生まれた左京区は鴨川_(淀川水系)左岸の洛東（洛外）地域にあたる。
sen.e: Originally, Sakyo indicated the east side area of Keian-kyo Capital (Rakuyo or Rakuchu), but the Sakyo Ward generated as an administrative area of Kyoto City is located in the Rakuto (Rakugai) area in the left side of Kamo-gawa River (in the Yodo-gawa River water system).

Originally, Sakyo indicated the east side area of Keian-kyo Capital (Rakuyo or Rakuchu), but the Sakyo Ward, which was born as an administrative area of Kyoto City, is located in the Rakuto (Rakugai) area in the left side of Kamo-gawa River (in the Yodo-gawa River water system).

Originally, Sakyo indicated the east side area of Heian-kyo Capital (Rakuyo or Rakuchu), but the Sakyo Ward, which was born as an administrative area of Kyoto City, is located in the Rakuto (Rakugai) area on the left side of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。"Kamo-gawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 現在はその後の市町村の統廃合により、更に外縁の旧愛宕郡部を中心としたかなり大きなものとなっている（右京区が旧京北町と合併するまでは、京都市全11区の中で最も大きい面積の区であった）。
sen.e: Due to reorganization of cities, towns and villages, the area of this ward now becomes considerably large, centered on former Otagi-gun Conty which was located remotely (until Ukyo Ward merged former Keihoku-cho Town, Sakyo Ward occupied the largest land area among all the eleven wards of Kyoto City).

Due to reorganization of cities, towns and villages, the area of this ward has become considerably large, centered on former Otagi-gun Conty which was located remotely (until Ukyo Ward merged former Keihoku-cho Town, Sakyo Ward occupied the largest land area among all the eleven wards of Kyoto City).

Due to reorganization of cities, towns and villages, the area of this ward has become considerably large, centered on former Otagi-gun which was located remotely (until Ukyo Ward merged former Keihoku-cho, Sakyo Ward occupied the largest land area among all the eleven wards of Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。
他の記事と統一しました。

sen.e: Kamo-gawa River (鴨川) (in the Yodo-gawa River water system)
Kamo-gawa River (鴨川) (in the Yodo-gawa River water system)
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 左京区は京都における北陸への玄関である。
sen.e: Sakyo Ward is placed at the gateway to the Hokuriku region from Kyoto.
Sakyo Ward is placed at the gateway to the Hokuriku region from Kyoto.
Sakyo Ward is placed at the gateway to the Hokuriku region from Kyoto.

sen.j: 古来より鯖街道と呼ばれる海産物の運送ルートが何本も走っていた。
sen.e: From the ancient times, many routes for transporting marine products to Kyoto, called Saba Kaido (mackerel roads), existed.
From ancient times, many routes for transporting marine products to Kyoto, called Saba Kaido (mackerel roads), existed.
From ancient times, many routes for transporting marine products to Kyoto, called Saba Kaido (mackerel roads), existed.

sen.j: 現在でも国道367号は京都と福井を結ぶ幹線道路である。
sen.e: Even now, national road 367 is a trunk road between Kyoto and Fukui.
Even now, national road 367 is a trunk road between Kyoto and Fukui.
Even now, National Route 367 is a trunk road between Kyoto and Fukui.
sen.cmt: 国道→National Route で統一しています。
他の記事と統一しました。
